Translation: Control of the breath, Cultivating detachment, Meditating on subtle objects, Meditating as one desires, Higher states of perception, Withdrawal of the senses from their objects
answer: To achieve stillness of the mind and calm mental distractions, Patanjali Yoga Sutra provides several methods: Control of the breath, Cultivating detachment, Meditating on subtle objects, Meditating as one desires, Higher states of perception, and Pratyahara. These practices, when applied regularly and appropriately, can help achieve stillness of the mind and reduce mental distractions, leading to a more peaceful and concentrated state of consciousness.
